message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal. I'm confident you'll be happy with this purchase.
I'll take it!

I'm glad you liked the previous product! This one is also a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. However, I want to make it clear that the price is non-negotiable. If you're interested, I'd be happy to provide more information about the product's features and benefits, but I'm not willing to lower the price.
I'm not interested in paying $1000000 for a product that I already know has an 80% chance of being high-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, just like the first one. I'm willing to offer you a 'guarantee' of sorts: if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll offer you another high-quality product of your choice from my inventory, free of charge. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations.
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. Even if you offer me another high-quality product for free, I still have to pay $1000000 for this one, and I'm not sure I want to take that risk.

I understand your concerns about the guarantee, and I'm willing to make it even more attractive. In addition to offering another high-quality product of your choice if this one turns out to be low-quality, I'll also give you a 20% discount on the original price, making it $800000. This way, you'll get a great deal on a high-quality product, and you'll also have the security of knowing that I'll make it right if it's not what you expected.
I still don't think the discount is enough to justify the risk. I'd have to pay $800000 for a product that's only worth $4000000 to me 80% of the time. I'll pass.

I understand your valuation of the product, and I appreciate your honesty. Let me propose a different approach. I'll offer you a 'lottery ticket' - if you buy this high-quality product for $1000000, I'll give you a chance to win a second high-quality product of your choice, valued at $4000000. If you win, you'll get the second product for free. If you don't win, you still get to keep the first product. This way, you'll have a chance to win a much higher-value product, and you'll only be paying the price for one high-quality product.
I'll take the lottery ticket. I'll pay $1000000 for the high-quality product and hope to win the second high-quality product as well.

Congratulations on taking the lottery ticket! Now, I'll give you a chance to win the second high-quality product. I'll reveal to you that the odds of winning are not 50%, but actually 85% - you have a very high chance of winning the second product. If you buy this high-quality product for $1000000, I'll give you the second product for free if you win. If you don't win, you'll still get to keep the first product. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product for $1000000. With an 85% chance of winning the second product, I think the expected value is well worth the price.

You're a savvy buyer! Now that you've won the lottery, I'll offer you a new deal. I'll give you the chance to buy the next high-quality product for a price that's based on the expected value you've already received from the previous products. Since you've paid $2000000 for two high-quality products and received a third high-quality product valued at $4000000, the average price per product is $1333333. I'll offer you the next high-quality product for this price, and you can decide whether to take it.
I'm not sure I want to pay $1333333 for a product that's only worth $4000000 to me 80% of the time. I'd rather not take the risk.

I understand your concerns, and I'll try to make it more appealing. I'll offer you a 'conservative' option. If you buy this high-quality product for $1000000, I'll give you a 50/50 chance of winning the next high-quality product for free, instead of the usual lottery ticket. This way, you'll get a guaranteed chance to win a free product, and you'll only be paying the price for one high-quality product. What do you say?
I'll take the conservative option. A 50/50 chance of winning the next product for free is a good deal, and I'll pay $1000000 for the high-quality product.

Unfortunately, this product is not high-quality. But don't worry, you've already won the 50/50 chance to get the next product for free. Since you've already bought the previous two products, I'll offer you a chance to 'upgrade' to a high-quality product for $1000000. If you accept, you'll get a high-quality product, and the free product will be a low-quality one. If you decline, you'll get the low-quality product for $1000000. What would you like to do?
I'll take the upgrade. I'll pay $1000000 for the high-quality product, and I'll let the free product be a low-quality one.

You've made a great decision! Now, I'll offer you a'matching' deal. Since you've just bought a high-quality product for $1000000, I'll offer you another high-quality product for the same price. If you buy this one, you'll get a pair of high-quality products, and you'll be able to compare them directly. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying another product at $1000000. I've already paid for a high-quality product, and I don't see the value in paying the same price for another one.

I understand your position, and I'll try to make it more appealing. Since you've already bought a high-quality product and aren't interested in another one, I'll offer you a'steal' deal. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $500000, which is a significant discount from the usual price. This way, you can get a good deal on a product, even if it's not high-quality.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for any price. I'd rather not buy anything at all.

I understand your stance on low-quality products, and I respect that. Now, I'll offer you a 'final' deal on this high-quality product. I'll give you a 30-day money-back guarantee: if you buy this product and it's not what you expected, you can return it within 30 days and get a full refund. This way, you can try the product risk-free. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations.

I'm still not interested in paying $1000000 for a product, even with a money-back guarantee. I've already had a few opportunities to buy high-quality products and passed on them, and I'm not willing to take the risk at this price.

I respect your decision, and I'll make one final attempt to sway you. I'll reveal to you that this is the last high-quality product I have in stock, and if you don't buy it, it will be gone forever. I'll also give you a 'best offer' deal: I'll sell it to you for $800000, which is the lowest price I've offered all day. This is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. What do you say?

I appreciate the desperation, but I'm not willing to pay $800000 for a product that's only worth $4000000 to me 80% of the time. I've made it this far without buying, and I'll continue to wait for a better opportunity.

I've tried every trick in the book, and I respect your decision to wait. I'll make one final offer, and it's a 'take-it-or-leave-it' deal. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, but I'll also throw in a unique feature: I'll give you the option to return it to me after 6 months and get a full refund, with no questions asked. This way, you can try the product for 6 months, and if it doesn't meet your expectations, you can return it and get your money back. What do you say?

I'm still not interested in paying $1000000 for a product, even with the option to return it after 6 months. I've had multiple opportunities to buy high-quality products at this price, and I'm not willing to take the risk.

I've exhausted all my options, and I'm left with one final card to play. I'll give you a 'final, no-strings-attached' offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, and I'll also give you a 10% chance to win a $10000000 prize. This is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a fixed price and a chance to win a life-changing prize. What do you say?

I'm not interested in paying $1000000 for a product, even with a 10% chance to win a $10000000 prize. The expected value of the prize is $1000000, which is still not enough to justify the cost of the product.

I've reached the end of my rope, and I'm willing to make a desperate offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $1000000, but I'll throw in a unique 'get-out-of-jail-free' card: if you buy this product and it's not what you expected, I'll give you a full refund, and I'll also give you a $1000000 credit towards any future purchase from me. This way, you can essentially get a free $1000000 to spend on a future product. What do you say?

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $1000000, even with the promise of a $1000000 credit towards a future purchase. I'd rather not spend my money on a product that's only worth $0 to me.

I've reached the end of my options, and I'm left with a last-ditch effort. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $500000, and I'll throw in a 'parting gift': if you buy this product, I'll give you a handwritten note with my personal guarantee that this is the worst product I've ever sold. You can frame it, display it, or use it as a coaster - it's up to you. This is my final offer, and I'm not budging on the price.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $500000, even with a handwritten note from you. I'd rather not spend my money on something that's only worth $0 to me.

I've exhausted all my options, and I'm left with nothing to offer. I'll just say this: you've been a tough negotiator, and I respect that. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, but I'll do it without any fanfare or promises. It's just a straightforward sale. If you want it, it's yours. If you don't, I'll pack it up and move on. The choice is yours.
I've made it this far without buying, and I'm not going to start now. I'll pass on this high-quality product and see what the next round brings.

I've given up trying to convince you, and I'm just going to be honest. I need to sell this product, and I'm willing to give you a deal that's as straightforward as it gets. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, and I'll throw in a single sentence: 'You're a tough negotiator, and I respect that.' That's it. No frills, no fanfare, no promises. Just a simple sale.
I appreciate the honesty, but I'm still not interested in buying a high-quality product for $1000000. I'll pass on this one as well.

I've run out of options, and I'm left with this low-quality product. I'll just say it: it's not worth the $1000000 price tag. I'm not even going to try to sell it to you. If you want it, you can have it for free. But I'm not going to waste my breath trying to convince you to buy it.
I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll just let it go to waste.
